text.p: These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The cabinet approved a $350 million programme of public investments after a marathon 10-hour meeting.
- Portugal's Minister of Internal Administration, Alberto Bernardes Costa, is due to visit Angola from Wednesday.
- The United Nations special envoy to Angola, Alioune Blondin Beye, visited an exposition of landmines in the capital Luanda and organised by an Angolan committee pushing for a ban on landmines.
